intro: Dioryktandra roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan balsam, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its roots are fibrous and can spread extensively, contributing to its invasive potential in some regions. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to various parts of the world.
